description: Collaborated with senior engineers to modernize and migrate web applications and APIs to cloud infrastructure.
Supported database migrations by validating schema changes, redeploying services, and ensuring data consistency.
Designed and implemented internal and external APIs with structured logging and regression testing for improved reliability.
Participated in API modernization and template migration efforts to align with cloud and microservice standards.
Verified system health and API performance after releases using Datadog dashboards and alerts to ensure stability and up-time.
Co-authored AACR 2024 abstract on spatial transcriptomic analysis of prostate cancer.
Developed and maintained custom bio-informatics pipelines for processing genomics data using R and Python.
Worked closely with researchers and scientists to understand and meet their needs and requirements for bio-informatics data analysis.
Analyzed large-scale genomic data sets to identify genetic variations and relative gene expressions.
Utilized Louvain clustering algorithm to group cells into clusters and used UMAP projections for dimension reduction.
Processed single-cell RNA sequencing data for analysis and visualization of single-cell and spatially resolved datasets.
Handled documentation for updating the development environment to .NET Framework 4.8 to decrease the provisioning time.
Enhanced deployment control by implementing LaunchDarkly feature flags and updated configuration management.
Built and maintained CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps to automate deployments, testing, and release validation.
Pioneered Playwright automation framework and presented implementation strategy company-wide to improve test coverage.
Tutored various mathematics and computer science classes at Chapman University, supporting student learning and assignments.
Chapman University: B.S. in Software Engineering, Minor in Game Development Programming | May 2022
Awards: 2022 IEEE GameSIG Finalist | Dean's Scholar | Thurgood Marshall Scholar | CSF Sealbearer
